title: American_Top_40_1987_January_17th
description:
"These are the hits from Boston, Massachusetts, to Boston, Georgia; from Boston, Indiana, to Boston, Ohio. And now from Beantown, here's the band Boston with 'We're Ready'."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Huey Lewis & The News debut their song "Jacob's Ladder" into the top 100 all the way up at number 40. It was written by Bruce Hornsby who has his first hit, "The Way It Is" at number 15.

A former member of the Cars has a hit but it isn't Rick Ocasek.

Casey plays a song from the biggest album ever in chart history. It spent 37 weeks at number 1 and generated seven top 10 hits.

The first act ever to hit the Pop, Soul, Dance, and Latin charts simultaneously has a song in this countdown.

The first singer in chart history to hit the top 10 in four different decades has the song that helped him do it in this countdown.

LW#2: Notorious - Duran Duran
LW#1: Walk Like An Egyptian - The Bangles
